north-america.name: North America
north-america.description: Diverse diving with kelp forests and sea lions.
north-america.bestTime: May–October for temperate Pacific, year-round for Florida.

united-states.name: United States
united-states.description: California kelp forests, Florida springs, and Pacific Northwest wrecks.

canada.name: Canada
canada.description: British Columbia's cold water diving, wrecks, and marine life.

mexico.name: Mexico
mexico.description: Cenotes, whale sharks, and Pacific pelagics from Baja to the Yucatán.

monterey.name: Monterey
monterey.description: World-famous kelp forests, sea otters, harbor seals, and macro life. Cold water diving with dramatic underwater topography and rich biodiversity.
monterey.bestTime: September–November for best visibility; diving possible year-round.

san-diego.name: San Diego
san-diego.description: Kelp forests, La Jolla Cove sea lions, leopard sharks, and wrecks. Accessible shore and boat diving with abundant marine life.
san-diego.bestTime: July–October for warmest water and best visibility.

channel-islands.name: Channel Islands
channel-islands.description: Remote, protected islands with pristine kelp forests, sea lions, garibaldi, and clear water. Includes Anacapa, Santa Cruz, Santa Barbara, and more.
channel-islands.bestTime: July–October for warmest water and best visibility.

catalina.name: Catalina Island
catalina.description: Famous for kelp forests, giant black sea bass, bat rays, and clear water. Casino Point is a top shore dive site.

anacapa.name: Anacapa Island
anacapa.description: Smallest Channel Island, known for kelp forests, sea lions, and arch dive sites.

point-lobos.name: Point Lobos
point-lobos.description: Marine reserve near Carmel, famous for healthy kelp forests, harbor seals, and macro life.

big-sur.name: Big Sur
big-sur.description: Dramatic, remote coastline with kelp forests, sea otters, and challenging conditions. Advanced diving only.

palos-verdes.name: Palos Verdes
palos-verdes.description: Rocky reefs, kelp forests, and macro life near Los Angeles. Popular shore diving spots include Old Marineland and Malaga Cove.

malibu.name: Malibu
malibu.description: Iconic beaches, kelp forests, and rocky reefs. Sites like Leo Carrillo and Paradise Cove are popular for shore diving.

la-jolla.name: La Jolla
la-jolla.description: Famous for sea lion and leopard shark encounters, kelp forests, and accessible shore diving at La Jolla Cove and Shores.

florida.name: Florida
florida.description: Wrecks, reefs, and freshwater springs from the Keys to the Panhandle.

florida-keys.name: Florida Keys
florida-keys.description: Coral reefs, shipwrecks, and the only living barrier reef in the continental US.

key-largo.name: Key Largo
key-largo.description: John Pennekamp Coral Reef State Park and the Spiegel Grove wreck.

key-west.name: Key West
key-west.description: Wrecks, reefs, and laid-back island diving at the southernmost point.

blue-heron-bridge.name: Blue Heron Bridge
blue-heron-bridge.description: World-famous macro site and easy shore dive in Palm Beach.

west-palm-beach.name: West Palm Beach
west-palm-beach.description: Drift diving, reefs, and goliath groupers.

jupiter.name: Jupiter
jupiter.description: Shark diving, turtles, and strong Gulf Stream currents.

pensacola.name: Pensacola
pensacola.description: Wreck diving capital of the Gulf, including the USS Oriskany.

crystal-river.name: Crystal River
crystal-river.description: Swim with manatees and explore freshwater springs.

devils-den.name: Devil's Den
devils-den.description: Prehistoric spring and cavern diving in North Florida.

ginnie-springs.name: Ginnie Springs
ginnie-springs.description: Crystal-clear freshwater springs and cave diving.

baja-california.name: Baja California
baja-california.description: Sea lions, whale sharks, and big animal action in the Sea of Cortez.

yucatan.name: Yucatán Peninsula
yucatan.description: Cenotes, Cozumel reefs, and Caribbean drift diving.

pacific-northwest.name: Pacific Northwest
pacific-northwest.description: Cold water diving, giant octopus, and shipwrecks in Washington and Oregon.
